name: Entrenchment ratio
functionStatement: Frequent overbank flows reduce flood peaks, support riparian vegetation, create off-channel refugia, and extend nutrient processing time.
descriptionMarkdown: Channel is not deeply incised; moderate floods access a broad floodplain, matching reference conditions.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compute entrenchment ratio as flood-prone width (often about 2x bankfull depth) divided by bankfull width using DEM or LiDAR cross sections and bankfull indicators.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Entrenchment ratio >2.2, or consistent with reference type, indicating frequent floodplain access.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Severely entrenched or walled channel with little or no moderate flood access.
